title: Education
text:
Awards

Helga and Wolfgang Gaul Stiftung Award (2017). This award is given biannually to a young researcher (\(<\) 30 years) with high potential working in the area of Classification, Clustering and related topics. The award is presented by the International Federation of Classification Societies (IFCS).
Crouch Joy Varney-Blackburn award for the best oral presentation in occupational therapy, psychiatry and mental health at the OTASA Congress 2024. Title: The impact of early referral on milestone development of babies with Down Syndrome at the Bloemfontein Child Information Centre. Authors: Dorothy Russell, Olive Khaliq & Johané Nienkemper-Swanepoel.
First prize in the postgraduate oral presentation competition of SASA in 2019. Title: Extended applications of GPAbin biplots.
First prize in the postgraduate paper competition of SASA in 2017 and 2014. Title: Exploratory study for the visualisation of incomplete multivariate categorical data (2017). Title: Multiple imputation using regularised iterative multiple correspondence analysis (2014).
Recipient of the Dean’s medal for the best honours degree student in the faculty of Natural and Agricultural sciences in 2012 at the University of the Free State.
Recipient of the Senate medal for the best honours degree student at the University of the Free State in 2012.

title: J Nienkemper-Swanepoel
text: Johané Nienkemper-Swanepoel is a senior lecturer at Department of Statistics and Actuarial Science at Stellenbosch University in South Africa.
